It seems like this device was designed strictly as a security system as opposed to use as a nanny cam.
title: Meh...

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Yang
content: I have the both the stick up cam and this one. The Wifi connection of the stick up cam is fast and stable, but this one is not very good. Quite often it failed to connect to the camera. Tried two of them and they were similar so had to return both of them. Not recommended.
title: Wifi connection not stable

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Melanie Reuss
content: I thought I would like the ring cameras more, but the cheaper cameras I bought seem to respond and work better. I cannot change the position with a touch, I have to pay to keep my videos. There is a significant delay to connecting when I get an alert. It isn’t as user friendly as my cheaper cameras. The audio is ok... Even after setting the settings to “people” only it notifies me of chickens, cats, dogs, freaking butterflies at my front door... and then it’s hurry up and wait. I open the alert and then have to wait for about 30seconds for the camera to show... not my favorite purchase. Probably won’t buy any more of these, just. It as good as my $30 cameras purchased here as well Yeah, update. I still kind of hate them. I will not buy anymore. The incessant notifications for non human activity are awful. I set it to human only, still get EVERYTHING ELSE. The live feed doesn’t load well and I am certain it’s the camera and not my WiFi because my non ring cameras are very responsive. I hate them.
title: Updated. I would not buy these. Better quality cheaper camera than this are available

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Susan K. Lawson
content: This is great. We put on our lanai and it was picking up everything in view, but I adjusted the zone to where it is aimed at the door, the entrance-so no one can come in without this letting us. I have two spotlight rings out on carport and backyard. This front one is linked to the carport so if it goes off, the side light comes on and I’m pretty sure it record as well. I’d hate to say that is a 100% true statement-but I think that is how mine works. But the carport is by the lanai and could be why. Read in their description for fuller details on that. Gives us a lot of security. And being able to change the range of detection really helps on false alarms. Very inexpensive and monthly charge for all three videoing to keep as long as you need is around 10.00. I also got the extension chime that I use to have a stronger signal for our back camera.
title: I love Ring.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: G.z.
content: We were robbed by a friend. The police officer told us this is the best camera he has seen (and he has watched bank robberies on security cameras.) He was going home to purchase one! Thanks to the footage we were able to prosecute. The only downside is when watching the film you have to watch in minute increments.
title: Best camera for the price

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: david cooper
content: I nadded this camera to my ring doorbell / camera . It was very, very easy to set up ! I am a ZERO tech person and theI added this to my ring door device. The setup was actually easy. I did not realize that the saved images would only be available for a few weeks at no additional charge. Now I am on vacation and no stored vide is available, only live view !  So I have to sign up and pay more money for the devise to be of any value. Right now I am thinking of returning as soon as I get home.pp and camera me thruthe set-up ! The set-up took about 5 minutes or less !
title: service contract will be needed at extra cost !

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Gan S. Libisono
content: We love ring products.  Yes it has flaws. We might not get the video right away but that’s not ring issue.  It’s usually because the connection/the WiFi is not strong enough to transmit the video right away. But I am amazed with how much you can see with this small camera.  And the night vision is pretty good as well. I put one with motion detector on in the garage and it pretty much captures motion right away. People are also complaining about the subscription cost for saving the videos.  But that’s the price you paid if you want to be able to save the videos, otherwise where do you expect the video will be saved?  To me the subscription is minimal and it’s worth it to have especially if you have several ring cameras, which we do. I also prefer to have the plug in one, instead of the battery operated one. With the motion captures and the time we use to turn the video on to check on our dog, it’s easier and more efficient using the plug in one. This camera is pretty small but it has a great view because of the lens. And you can tilt it so you can capture more areas of the room where you place the camera.
title: Good picture quality

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Russell
content: What I wanted: An indoor camera with person detection that can trigger Alexa routines.  I got this, pretty much. However: I can understand if "People Only" detects my cat once in a while, but the sensitivity setting below that shouldn't (and it most definitely).  It also shouldn't think motion is there when a light comes on in the hallway, and the hallway is only 5-10% of the image at most (a light for the entire room I could understand). Also, it doesn't have native geofencing, just like all their other cameras, so you need to use a smart outlet to turn it on/off (which I really dislike doing). Just don't see why it's so hard for them to implement stuff when other companies seem to do it (they just charge a little more).
title: Meh.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: cranford RS
content: Fine indoor cameras with very easy app set up. Reliable smartphone app notifications, although there is a short delay in ability to view video. Night vision when pointing outside through a window is non-existent even when disabling infrared, so this is not a good choice for outdoor viewing. Indoor in low light, cameras can revert to b&w regardless of infrared setting. But picture is very clear and motion alerts are dependable. At $60 per, you can't beat these cameras for an indoor set up...having 4 or 5 indoors won't break the bank and will give you dependable remote viewing and motion detection. At $10/month for their protect package, you can have a library of your video captures for a couple of months. These fine and inexpensive cameras are a no-brainer to provide reliable high quality indoor viewing. I will soon be ordering several more.
title: Fine quality indoor cameras at attractive price

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Sandra Harwood
content: This product was perfect for us.  I hate to leave my 80 year old father alone and it gives us piece of mind when we are gone. You are able to put the element on a counter or hang on wall.  Picture is clear and u can record or do live viewing. U can also talk to them through app on your phone which gives warning when there is movement by camera.  U have an option to shut off as well.  I placed by front door to see who is entering and exiting.(great for when kids get home), in living room...hung on wall and we can view entire room! Also have one in kitchen. If someone is in room you can turn sound on so you can hear everything that is going on in the room.  I will probably by one more for back door.  They are great!  Highly recommend!
title: Our Ring is amazing!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: unitmonster
content: I wish I had purchased these when I bought a baby monitor.  For essentially the same price you, get an HD, streaming camera that is easily accessible on your phone.  The app is easy to use and connects you to its own social media where other people who have cameras in your neighborhood can post videos (porch pirates, etc).  It makes me feel very safe to see my babysitters when my kids are left at home.  We have the google ring which is amazing as well and you can set it up to buzz your phone when it detects motion.  Really changes the way I live my life, I know that sounds over the top, but I now can watch my house.  I am seriously debating putting up more in every room and every corner of my outdoor area.
title: These are amazing!! Best thing I've purchased in a long time

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Ken Edwards
content: I am using it to monitor my front room when I am in my office. Every ten minutes the Live View ends and I have to stop typing and keep pressing Reconnect to get the view again.  I can understand if it was a model that is battery powered to save battery, BUT MINE IS PLUGGED INTO THE WALL OUTLET.  Please fix this in future updates.
title: It needs a longer Live View time period.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Max Master
content: The camera was set up for 2 weeks to monitor my front door from the inside and my entry hallway. I open my front door and walk through the entry hallway at least 30% of the time there was no notification and no motion recording of the event on the app. I would walk through the hallway 1 minute later and motion would be detected suddenly, but the previous motion event went completely undetected. This went on from 2 weeks, even after getting a 2nd camera I would have the same problem of inconsistent motion detection. So I sent both cameras back. I can't trust the device because it is inconsistent.
title: Inconsistently detects motion

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Jessica M. Brant
content: I have two very sneaky three-year old boys who like to creep downstairs at 5 AM to steal any treats they can find. We put this camera at the bottom of our stairs so that we'd be alerted when they get up. We've been using it for a few months now and it's worked really well! We have it set up through our Echo dot in our bedroom, which loudly announces "Motion Detected at the Stairs." It also alerts our phones through the app, where we can also view the video footage. The night vision is clear. A happy side effect is that they are not sleeping in later since they know they can't get away with stealing bags of chocolate chips anymore! So everyone is sleeping better.
title: Excellent!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: R. Traugh
content: I have ring doorbell and ring alarm both required calls to customer service to work, door cam was replaced at no charge and worked great after that. After trying to set up this small camera for an hour it suddenly worked, until I moved it 2 inches, plug on back came out, I didn’t have plug pushed in enough ha!, that and WiFi are now ok, won’t connect to my 5g though, but even set on silent notification cam plays a tone on movement or if you check feed on phone another tone from cam, only way to make silent is if you turn off motion detector and turn off recording, I guess if someone breaks in they will know they are being recorded by hearing tone notice, if I can silence this I’ll give it 5 stars. Update. Turned this on again, now silent on recording or checking movement, fixed itself. Great 5 stars
title: I like it, small size is great, tone notifications fixed

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Get Physically Fit, LLC
content: Since I had a ring doorbell, I didn't want another system for Amazon Key, such as the Amazon Cloud Cam for delivery to my garage, so I selected this ring product. I haven't had a chance to try it since Amazon Key is suspended and rightfully so with COVID-19. Great Audio and visual features is the plus. One thing to consider (unlike say a Lorex Camera) is the cost of monitoring service. It's either "Protect Basic" which is a $30 (which is going up with new tax) fee per camera or Protects Plus which covers all devices and professional monitoring for all devices at $100 annually which if I had the entire home system that would be a steal vs what I'm paying for my monitoring system). The catch in all this is you have to pay as the mini camera I purchased to go along with my amazon key does not store video at all without a subscription. Not even for 24 hours like the Amazon Cloud Cam So if you're not near your device when a delivery arrives to view it then you have no record of who opened your garage. I think that needs to be better explained as I'm looking at returning this now in favor of the Amazon Cloud Cam. Its a little bit more upfront but with Ring requiring a subscription for any recording, well in the long run it becomes a better deal. Since Ring is owned by Amazon, I would like to suggest to Ring to either 1. offer tier discounts for multiple camera purchases 2. one or two add on service or for those who are already paying for one subscription 3. or at least provides 24-hour recording 4. or just mimick your parent companies' ACC 4 tier plan
title: Great Camera

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Mitchell J. Hilger
content: No pan and tilt, which I knew., and not why I give it only 3 stars.  My main complaint is  missing info that a cheaper pan and tilt I have provided, like a built in SD card for temp video storage, time and date in the stream. But I was under the impression that my ring doorbell subscription required only a small addition annual amount to store the video. No it is a similar $30 /year. And with no local storage in the camera, if the Wi-Fi gets interrupted, then no notification or video. So anyone with a Wi-Fi jammer circumvents the camera and it’s functionality.
title: Really disappointed, not on par with other offerings

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Chuck T
content: Camera seems to work well, although with both of them I had a hard time getting the power cable to plug into the device. The cable is recessed well into the back and it is hard to tell if it is plugged in and working. On this point I bought the 2-pack, one was extremely difficult to plug in the other moderately. Not a good design, and the reason for only 4 stars. Once over that hurdle, the cameras work quite well. The night vision initially wasn't very good, (all I could see is the reflections off my vehicles license plates) but it seems the cameras have adapted and both day and night vision is very good, both the clarity and field of vision. I like the capability to turn off the cameras when I am in the building so I don't get dozens of notifications as I move around. I will most likely handle this through my WIFI router though, as I can group the devices (inside cameras, outside cameras) and disable them together rather than individually. Maybe the Ring app has this capability and I just haven't found it yet. Once I got them working, I am very happy with them, but being in a cold barn fighting to plug them in was a real turnoff (no pun intended!)
title: Great device, but difficult to plug in!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: K. Quaintance
content: I haven’t had the time to play with all the options yet ,  but it worked great ! Just what I needed . I installed these nice cameras before  I left for a trip and I was able to keep an eye on my home while I was away.  The nonstop live action video is smooth and the night time vision is much better than some security cameras I’ve tried in the past,  and the fact that I can hear and talk through the cameras  was a big plus.  Thank you so much..  Perfect!  =)  I  am very happy with my purchase.
title: Just In Time

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Johnny P
content: As with the ALL the other Ring products we've purchased, terrible annoying audio, stupidly long activation wait times to see a live signal. I wish we had not invested at all. We'll live with them for as long as we can tolerate (or until a stimulus payment shows up), then toss all of them into the trash and go with Eufy (the only cam in the house that is actually worth what we paid). Ring - pfffft., If you buy, the JOKE is on YOU. Update 09-01-2020: sending everything within the 30 day return window will allow. All my Ring units locked me out today with a "406 Not Acceptable" error. Defect or not, it's not at my end. Some support forum posts suggest that means that your IP has been banned or blocked by ring. No help from call center on that, so time to switch to Eufy.
title: Horrid audio, just as bad as our Ring doorbell and spotlight cams. Good way to waste hard earned $$$

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Reaper
content: I’ve been with Ring since 2017 so I’ve trusted their brand with my doorbell camera since then and they’ve never let me down. I’m not entirely a fan of their subscription to allow for recording on their cloud service (I’d rather just use a memory card and spare me the price), but it’s alright. It’s not terribly expensive. Depending on where you live, I’d be cautious on how you use the Neighbors feature of the Ring app once you do have it set up and running. It’s all anonymous commenting so a lot of your “neighbors” can be very condescending and downright rude if you post a safety concern that they dismiss as irrelevant. Ring doesn’t do a good job of taking down those comments either. Outside of that, the camera works as intended and the image is sharp and reliable for every setting you put it on.
title: Great camera and app. I wouldn’t use the Neighbors feature.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: B. Montgomery
content: These are trash. Why in Hades did they make the RESET button so huge and touchy on the top of the camera that even the molecules from the wind of passing by will trigger it, thus deactivating the device and putting it into setup mode!?!? And you can’t turn off setup from the app, the only way to turn it off is to hold the oversized touchy button for 10 seconds to reboot the device. And half the time, rebooting it makes it forget your network and so it’s in PERMANENT setup mode. I can’t understand how this is good for either security or for watching unruly kids (our use) - all anyone who doesn’t want to be seen has to do is brush the top of the camera and BOOM - disabled. Garbage.
title: Garbage

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: marcus
content: A cheaper version of their stickup cams. If you already have ring cameras these work ok, especially if you have a ring plan to save events to the cloud. It can be made to operate with ring alarm so it will record if the alarm is triggered. It will record for 3 minutes if activated by alarm. No local storage to SD card. I don't know why Ring will not put an easy to use on/off switches for these in the app. I would not trust these if I had a family. For those that don't need the cloud storage the Wyze Cams are less than half the price easy on/off, local storage and work as well or better. Edited to add: Ring contacted me to tell me how to link these cameras to the Ring alarm using app dashboard. It is done in mode settings. The cameras will turn on and off when arming or disarming alarm. There is the on/off switch I was looking for. I will give it 4 stars now
title: On off with alarm settings

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: David F
content: It does a very bad job of picking up sound. I had an echo dot playing music nearby and when I listened in using the app I couldn’t hear any sound. I then looked at the recording and there wasn’t any sound on that.  I also noticed a delay in the recording of motion. If someone were to run fast enough past the camera, I wouldn’t be able to see what the camera detected. It also notified me that it had detected motion in a room in my home while I was out of town on Christmas Eve. I reviewed the recording and didn’t see anything. It ruined my night because I was worried someone may have broke into my home. It turned out to be a false alarm. I was going to purchase more Ring products but it’s unreliable. I’m going to return this product and purchase something else.
title: False alarm on Christmas Eve

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Jeff A. Sturges
content: Me and my wife have ten (10) Nest cameras and have often wondered how accurate they were. There were more times than most that my wife would walk into the house and a minute or so later, the Nest outdoor camera would text a message that someone was spotted. I have a mesh wi-fi system with a 40 Mb upload speed at each camera so I couldn’t imagine that latency would, or should be an issue but I was wrong and not with just one (1) Nest camera but all the Nest camera’s. We purchase two (2) Ring indoor camera’s and found that the Ring indoor cameras would notify immediately, and the Nest outdoor cameras would be delayed by a minute or In short, we are planning on replacing our ten (10) Nest cameras with Ring cameras for two (2) reasons; 1. All cameras have a deafening siren. 2. Outdoor cameras have both flood light and siren 3. A speaker that someone outside can hear. 4. Cost. The Ring cameras offer more security amenities than Nest hands down!
title: Works like a clock!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: MB2312
content: This is the second ring indoor wired camera that I have bought. The first one had to go back because it failed at setup and I immediately bought this one as a replacement. I’m having the same issues that I had with the first one. It goes through the set up process, and then falls off line and will not reconnect. The light won’t come on at all. The cord is plugged in firmly and nada! I’ve gone through all the steps to reboot the camera and the system, to no avail. I have had a ring security system (which I’ve had for three years). All the other components such as the doorbell cam, the two outdoor flood cameras and the  chime pro extender have all worked fine, But the indoor cameras have an issue that causes it to fail right after set up. Complete waste of money and time!
title: First cam was a lemon. Same with replacement

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Prototype Collector
content: Ok. My camera has been dead for over a month now. Bought in May of this year. I have the ring service yet it helps me in no way to get a replacement. They have limited hours due to covid. The camera starting failing the 1st week. Then I got it to work off and on throught the first 2 months. Then the entire thing went purple. Apparently the ir filter goes awry and the unit is toast. I reset my unit only for it to be lost off my network and not functional to be added back on. Wasted money and now time to wait and try to get someone to help. Not holding my breath. Out of 3 cameras I have owned fro. Ring...1 had orb issues, 1 constantly wouldnt turn off from night vision to daylight during the day unless unplugged, and now this one that died in less than 6 months.  Really was expecting much better from ring cameras.
title: Do not buy this camera! Not recommended

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Milissa menard
content: Works great!! Has a mount for wall mounting . Clear vision (even at night) Sound is ok, lags just a little Perfect for dog watching or if anyone comes in the door ....
title: Yes! Great camera

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: James S.
content: Update 9/28/2020: They have made great strides in fixing their software but I cannot get over I am expected to pay $30 per year to keep my videos, more if you have more than one camera. There are better free storage options out there. I wanted to like this camera and buy more but  I bought others. I was looking for a camera/motion sensor to go with Alexa to watch over the house when we are away (Guard mode). The problem is the Ring camera doesnt really tie into Alexa. Alexa understands it but cant seem to control it. When we are home I tell it to stop telling us there is motion in the house and it says it cant do that. If I turn off motion detection in the Ring app, Alexa continues to tell us we are moving around. I finally had to disable Ring in Alexa. Now I have to enable motion detection when coming and going and tell Alexa we are coming and going. Pretty poor. Im still debating returning it.
title: Poor Alexa Integration

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Books123
content: My Ring Alarm System, bought on Prime Day 2019, had its first (and only) false alarm the day before Amazon's Cyber Monday sale.  Coincidence?  My cynicism says no, but to avoid unnecessary dispatches of emergency services in the future, I decided to add a couple of these Ring Indoor Cams to my system to replace my two Netgear Arlo Q cameras. The cheaper Ring Indoor Cam has similar video quality, but a less adjustable mount and a shorter, inferior power cord integrated in a bulky power adapter.  But the "people only" motion detection and the integration with the Ring Alarm System are advantages that justify this purchase.  Netgear provides 1 week of free cloud storage but Ring does not, so Ring cameras really only make financial sense if you already have a Ring Protect Plus plan on your Ring Alarm System.
title: Good as Part of Ring Alarm but Worse Hardware Than Arlo Q

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Feedback is a gift
content: Quality and price are great and it was very easy to set up. The one thing that I am not very happy with is the very loud click that the camera makes when it turns on nightvision. It sounds like someone snapping their fingers every single time which is not only annoying but made me shut off the night vision so it stops which kind of defeats one of the features of the camera. I wouldn't buy another indoor camera unless this gets fixed.
title: Great product with one annoying problem

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Robert Seamster
content: The interface could be improved - but other than that this is a very good cam, especially for the money spent. Most importantly is the realiability - has immediately notified me every time I've walked in to test it.  Has always connected to arm/disarm without any issues. Added note: Still as realiable as before, however cam was hacked today. Leaving this morning it didn't give me the normal "buzz" activating it - got home and no buzz deactivating it - came in and motion set them off.  Checked the save history and both cameras had video and showed me entering - tried to delete the videos and they say "starred by another user" and I can't delete the video. I live in an apartment so somehow someone else has these cams set to their software as well and starred the video preventing it from being deleted.
title: Very reliable - immediate notification every time I've tested it

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: John N
content: power loss will cause loss of wifi connectivity which requires manual actions to restore. This limits placement of device. Therefore battery version of camera is a better choice. Battery camera is great but the ability for the wired camera app to define any shape as an area of interest is better than that for door doorbell or wired cam. This means can ignore floor area and cats. App should offer wired camera motion features for all cameras. App should send notification when device goes offline. supplied power connector is difficult to firmly insert.
title: some annoying issues

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Freddie Stewart
content: - 03Oct2020_5.30P Right out the box, bundle of two, both power up, and sync.  But in less than 10mins, one burns out?  Literally, I have unplugged it from both ends, reseated,  moved outlets (it was warm to the touch when I first noticed all the lights were out). Brand new out the box, burnt out.  Will try and reach vendor.  Maybe an update is coming depending on how quickly and easy they make the response. - 03Oct2020_6.15P ((Update)) Called Ring.  Man, thier customer service was quick, no long wait time.  I was annoy he made me do all the same crap I just did before (move outlets, power off, hold the button to reset - but I know they have to or they get in trouble (I too am a IT Pro and the struggle is real lol).  But then just like that, "OK, a new one will be at your door in 5 to 7 business days."  Was not happy about the 5 to 7 business days, since Amazon had it here in 24hrs with Prime, but hey, its a free replacement and they didn't just leave me out to dry.  They get 3 stars for the quick response.  Will update when it gets here and IF it works.
title: Tech Issues

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: A Vitela
content: For what you pay, it is good. The wire is a nuisance. The material let the wire twist or curl so much on its own so it would pull and shift the camera to a different direction. Listening to live or video I could make out what was being said, but the two-way talk when I tried to communicate with someone in the room, it was hard for the other person to understand me talking through the app. I checked it out myself and it could be unclear as to what the app holder is saying. Other than that the quality is great. The night vision is very clear to me. I would give the more expensive ring cam a try though just because this $60-some could be better.
title: Good but could be better.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Kevin
content: Works generally but leaves you wanting more. Lots of expected features just don't exits yet. Especially if your pairing with a Ring alarm. In fact if you intend to use the cameras with the alarm, wait till they add features or look for a different system. You can't have the motion from ring cameras trigger the alarm, you can have the alarm trigger the cameras, but your limited by your internet bandwidth and they don't recommend activation more than 2 cameras, which would be fine if you could select which sensor triggers which cameras but that not possible currently. You can't link sensors to cameras, only the base station, so theres no way to map sensor X to camera Y. Only the entire alarm to some subset of cameras. Good luck dealing with that if you have multiple entry ways to monitor. You also can't select what mode you get motion notifications from your cameras in. You either always get notification, or never get any. That means setting it up to do something as basic as, "only send me camera motion notifications when the alarm system is armed," isn't possible. You either have to deal with unending notifications all the time when you're home and lots of unwanted recordings, or no notifications at all when you're away, that or remember to manually turn on notifications when you leave your house. But whats the point of a "smart" system if it's that dumb. They seem to be adding features here and there, but some REALLY basic stuff is missing and it being on the second generation you'd really expect these features. I work in tech and its very disappointing to see these frankly rudimentary features missing. Put it this way, if I was an investor, you'd not be getting my seed money. Overall, if someone asked me if they should get a Ring system, I'd say wait if you intend to integrate it with cameras. It's a good design and easy to set up, but is lacking A LOT of what you would expect from a smart system.
title: Works generally, but leaves you wanting some frankly rudimentary features.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: RM
content: The Camera quality is OK. There is no easy way to save data locally. The Ring desktop app keeps sending motion alert although I disabled the motion alert and it was disabled property on Android app. therefore, whenever I turn on my laptop, it keeps sending me motion alerts. However, the desktop/windows app does not show the video stream from the Ring cam and it only supports the Ring doorbell !!!! Also continuous recording like Nest would be appreciated. Since it sometimes takes the camera to activate and send the alerts to cellphone, and it takes quite some time for the app to pop up, when I finally see the video on my app, it's too late. Same problem with the Ring doorbell.
title: Expected much more

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: CharB
content: Ok so I have the doorbell no issues connecting to my WiFi but these cameras are glitchy they’re showing scrambled video and taking LONG to even load a live view nothing else is connected to my WiFi but the doorbell and 2 ring cameras kind of irritating 😑😑😑 waiting time see how well they show tonight after dark if I can even view the live video at that point. Update: haven’t had these 1 week and one camera that’s close to my modem/router has disconnected twice without me realizing it until a whole day later. Ring customer service was helpful and helped me connect it back but then it did it again the next day I haven’t had the issue with my upstairs camera or my ring doorbell 2.
title: Expected better for the price

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Joe K
content: Field of view isn't as large as other units but it's also much lower price point. Night vision is also excellent. Only annoyance is the bright blue light which can be covered with electrical tape If you have a more ring cameras or even ring alarm then this is a great addition. It doesn't have some feature such as a temperature but the app makes it great Ring added a privacy option to block out custom areas
title: Wonderful

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Rtwodogs
content: Sadly I must say I don’t like ring.  I bought this camera to monitor my pets action during the day.  I like the live feature and also, dying the free one month of videos, go back and see their activity.  Now I MuST subscribe forever for 30$ year.  While that is a small amount it is then principal of it that the camera is worthless without subscription.  There are other products that offer varied options including 25 hour retention of videos at no extra cost.  That would have worked- I guess I thought I’d get a year like at Costco for the ring doorbell.  I do pay 30 for that and each add on is 30/year up to 100 year... again this is a short term video need and Ring does not offer daily recording storage.  I do NoT recommend this device or Ring.
title: Must subscribe for this to work

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Happy Bigfoot guy
content: I marked it low because I ordered  one refurbished stick up and it didn’t work, was sent a replacement it didn’t work.  I figured got a new one for the extra $20.00 problem solved. Kinda, I set it up worked fine waited for it to up date.  I tested it worked as expected, I later went to move it and unplugged it moved it and would not work again.  It had a solid green light and would not go back into setup mode.  Called customer service and they tried what they could but nothing.  So this time I’m getting my replacement from ring instead of Amazon.  Hopefully it works. Ring customer service is great, just getting questionable units.
title: Not ordering again

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: L Rodriguez
content: Bought this as a pet cam, because I have the ring doorbell and ring stick up and I’m very satisfied with. However, this one is junk. It will not stay connected to WiFi past a few days despite being literally next to the WiFi router and my WiFi not being changed at all. I constantly have to reset and connect it back to the WiFi, but you can only do that in person while standing next to the camera. I travel for work this is extremely inconvenient and losing signal while I’m gone is frustrating!!! After last time resetting it, it hasn’t disconnected in over two weeks. Of course, it decided to disconnects itself two days after I leave on vacation. Going to try to return
title: Junk

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: corey wright
content: a month ago my uncle fell and hurt himself in the kitchen in his home my sick aunt was trying to help him up and couldn't lift him he was on the floor prior to that for 3 hours before my aunt found him she eventually call me and I call the ambulance needless to say I was thinking of ways to care for them while I'm away in case of an emergency and this camera system gives me a peace of mind knowing when I'm not around my sick aunt and uncle I can watch them and make sure they are good and well the quality is clear and the audio is great it's easy to set up the only problem I have is that the cord should be at least 20-22 feet for wall mounting
title: love it

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Martin W. Novak
content: Buying this was a Hail Mary for being able to keep track of our dogs when we’re away from the house. The male dog, in particular has destroyed multiple pillows and a couple of dog beds in his fits of anger. With the two-way communication, we can check in on them any time and even speak to them. And, yes, it sounds like out voices coming through that tiny little speaker. In addition, I’m getting notifications posted by others in the area when things are caught on their outdoor cameras. Just received on minutes ago about a questionable vacuum cleaner salesman, complete with color video. My wife saw this and suggested we get a Ring doorbell, too. Probably will. By the way, it seems to settle the dogs down when they can hear from us. Just sayin’.
title: Best $60 Dollars I’ve Spent

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: S Fam
content: So far I am enjoying catching all of the mischief happening in front of my house. I have the camera placed on the inside of my house looking out through a window. I did have to turn off the night vision and cover the indicator to be able to view anything at night. I like that with "modes" I can disarm the cameras if I or my family will be the cause of the alerts. Price is ok but the downside is that if you lose internet/Wi-Fi, these cameras will not record.
title: Great value for what you get. Will probably buy more.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Abel
content: Amazing cam! Picture on iPhone is crystal clear. Setup was monkey simple. The size is about half the height of a TV remote. Now build quality. The cam doesn’t seem it would take a drop. It is very light plastic but I wouldn’t call it flimsy. The mounting options are great. I had to return my cam because the usb connection into the cam was not secure and kept falling out or lose connection. I suspect the first shipments will have some build quality issues. Almost forgot, this cam includes a security siren. Not really loud but it is a nice add on.
title: Almost 5 Stars

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: AdamW.
content: Worked great the first day. Clear picture good audio when it was turned on. How ever the next day, apparently something changed and all I receive now is a black screen. Online the help section says to check my router settings, even though it worked completely fine the first 24 hours, and I haven't touched anything in my router settings. It is quite annoying having to go configure router settings after it seemed to be fine after initial set up. Only reason I went with this camera is because I have the doorbell, which also missed delivery drivers placing items on the porch, but will endlessly notify me off my flag waving in the wind.
title: Worked fine for 24 hours, now a black screen

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Carol C
content: I have several ring cameras outside plus the ring doorbell. I love them all!  I have a Nest camera also but it loses connectivity all the time! It is not as reliable as the Ring. When my son had a seizure back in July I Purchased this camera for his man cave not only so I can keep an eye on him when I’m not right there but also to record the seizure if he has one again so we can show it to the doctor. Well, he had another seizure and his camera captured the entire thing. I brought it to the doctor and showed him and he was able to properly diagnose the type of seizure as a tonic clonic seizure which is not what they thought initially. Thank you Ring!
title: Ring captured seizure

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: lilysman
content: I bought 2 of these expecting just 2 cameras and turns out I didn’t read well enough and got 4 total! So anyways, I open the box and see these tiny tiny tiny cameras. Smaller than my hand. Thinking to myself “there’s absolutely no way this thing was worth what I paid.” After a few days of using them I’ll have to say my money was very well spent. I love all of my cameras and will definitely be using ring time and time again. Was not let down at all. Edit: I bought two more. One for my room and one for my patio outside. Most easiest set up in the world. Takes about 5-10 mins and it’s all good. I’m in love with these cameras. Near perfect quality, sound, and range. I love this tiny little thing.
title: Best camera I’ve ever had.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Emily
content: These are great little affordable indoor cameras. They do pick up a lot of motion and send notifications. Even though they are indoor cameras, the quality of night vision depends on how you use them. I wanted a simple solution (that doesn’t have to be mounted) to monitor my front door area. I put the camera facing the door from inside the window - this absolutely does not work at night. The camera has a blue light at night which reflects off the window and you can’t see anything. If it was used for solely monitoring indoors (like it’s meant to lol), it works great! If you’re looking to use these to monitor outside, don’t. Just get the outdoor cameras. :P
title: Great Indoor Cameras

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Roddy
content: This was a hit for me I’m a telecommunications learning specialist I teach direct tv , ADT, and all smart home products for Best Buy to all new hires and current employees for my company! So I get the chance and time to see all products and their different functions before I actually have to commit to a product, with that being said being we mostly install nest, arlo, and ring camera ring was more efficient for me “price wise” arlo is a very good product but can be on the expensive side the differences are YOUR WIFI arlo needs a SOLID internet connection but the feed station “base” is equipped to push out better signal ring is very solid BUT location of your router is KEY now most people don’t have the equipment and or the knowledge to just move their modem so this can tend to cause harsh judgment on the product in my install of my ring doorbell I chose to relocate my router in the best spot suitable for everything to function properly “again I have the knowledge and tools to do so, so your average person can’t  just pick it up and move it” there are products that you can buy to extend the signal for ring “zwave” devices ring has one for 49$ if you don’t want to go through th hassle of moving your router “key points” if your router is tucked away, hidden, or not exposed to open space your limiting your function of your service have it out let it breath!!!! All around this is a good product In my opinion and depending on what you what it for you have to always ask yourself WHY! And what do I need this for my family wanted this for the small children in our home and the monitoring of sneaky teenagers you don’t have to place this in private areas just areas of interest and monitoring I have one in my living room outside of the bedrooms and kitchen all places the small children can access I see a lot of reviews saying privacy it’s simple just don’t place it somewhere that is private to you!! Also the great functionality of this product if you don’t mount it it’s mobile and all though it’s not a outdoor camera you can place it in windows and areas that can see outside which will save you an added 100-200$ on purchasing a outdoor camera which in my experience of installing are a hassle to customers who aren’t tech savvy
title: Location of router is key

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Fynedyme
content: OK, I have mixed feelings about this product. The price is great and the product itself is good. This is my issue. I wish I was told that I needed to buy a monthly plan with the ring company in order to get the full function of the camera. And if your wifi isn't good the camera is useless. If you don't buy their plan after your one month trial you aren't able to record, rewind, or see anything unless it's live. Had I known I would have bought something different.
title: Not for me

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Peace
content: I had high hopes from this cam. I not only wanted to use this as a security cam but also for baby monitoring (sleep/play room). When my wife is streaming/watching live, and if I try to do the same on a different device at the same time, then it just kicks out my wife's live stream. Not just that, I'm not able to continuously leave the streaming on. It drops connection after a few mins of live streaming. These are bare minimum expectations (for me) from a camera and so I do not recommend this product to anyone. I'm stuck with the 'Ring' home security and camera line. Had I knew these limitations, I wouldn't have bought the Ring system at all.
title: Does not meet my expectations

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: LuAnne D
content: I have a ring door bell and added this so I could keep an eye on newborn pups. I really wanted something that was just a camera and inexpensive so I could check up on them when I was away. Had good luck with ring so I knew this would be easy to add. The only feature I don't like is there no way to turn off the annoying motion notification.  Like the great picture quality and the size of the camera.
title: Great little camera

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Rich
content: I purchased two units and both were easy to setup. They have worked well (almost too well) as I get motion detection from reflections of cars or even the sun notifying me of movement in my house as it comes through a window after a cloud passes. The image is crystal clear and even in night mode, my house looks like daytime. It has a wide field of view and captures a large area. The cloud service price is reasonable as I have other types with more expensive plans. Ring has many other features which make it the best on the market.
title: Great Product!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: 2r58
content: This was my second Ring purchase, as I had previously bought the Ring 2 video doorbell and had been pleased with the quality and performance.  I bought this Ring Indoor camera and had it set up and functioning for about 3 months.  During that time it was constantly disconnecting and reconnecting to the wifi, the doorbell was working simultaneously (and almost equidistant from the wireless router) with no issues.  When it worked it was fine, but that wasn't terribly often.  After 3 months, it quit working altogether, and I could not restart, reconnect, or even hard reset the device.  I won't purchase anymore Ring products and would highly recommend staying away from this camera.  Tried tech support, but too many unavailable reps and I don't have time to write an essay on the problem.
title: Poor Workmanship and Connectivity, Gave 1 Star Because Zero was not Possible

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: jennifer Charamuga
content: I bought this to replace a dysfunctional baby monitor camera since we have a ring doorbell and subscription. I was a little hesitant when I read a review saying it wasn’t compatible with a longer micro usb cable and that you had to use the one in the box but I didn’t find that to be true. It works with a 15 for micro usb cable I had previously bought on amazon so I was able to mount it where I wanted. My only wish is that they came out with a camera specific for baby monitoring that could sense the temperature in the room and also zoom. If ring made a camera specific for baby monitoring they would blow the competition out of the water because pretty much all baby monitors and cameras are garbage and/or break after a year.
title: Great bang for your buck

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Richard J. Penyak
content: I've always wanted to incorporate cameras in my home with my ADT plan but it was cost prohibitive. Well goodbye ADT! Il These mini cams are the best security investments I've made in my home yet and I can now have a piece of mind.  I was always reluctant to purchase ring products because of the negative  reviews concerning software issues. Setup and pairing was flawless and a breeze. I'm running the Ring app on a Samsung note 8. The only small gripe I have is the ghosting in live view which is not an issue. I can always download minute by minute videos that are absent of this ghosting effect. I do have my doubts on the claimed 1080p resolution, though there is definitely enough detail in the footage to help prosecute burglars. I have one of the cams in a well lit 12 x 20 kitchen and was hoping for tack sharp stills but am aware that achieving perfect resolution in such a small lens is nearly impossible, either way this is a great setup. Ring cams + Glock feels much safer than ADT where there's a 10 to 15 minute police response time. I've only had the police dispatched twice in 17 years. I'd recommend this product in a heartbeat and I plan on getting the RingPro doorbell to seal the deal.
title: The best piece of mind in my home security!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: jdziggy
content: These are junk. In the last 2 weeks, I have had to re-attempt setup on a camera 3 times. Once setup, it will randomly disconnect and not reconnect, requiring you to set it up again...re-link to Alexa, etc...but Rome wasn’t built in a day, right? Displeased with this product- also, if you have thoughts of using this device with an echo show as a child monitor, note that the video streams randomly disconnect frequently.
title: Unreliable

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: JC O’Connor
content: Already had a Ring system, added this economically priced cam to monitor inside the barn.  Cake. (Excuse the mess)
title: Indoor barn monitoring - perfect

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: RG
content: Cannot activate the device .Makes it pretty much pointless for Home security if you cannot see The Intruders. The only time I can activate it is when I get home and right next to the camera if I get lucky.I continuously get failure to activate notices after a week. I had the same problem with the stick up cam too from ring and had to return it. I might have to do the same with these and try a different security company. I have top-of-the-line Wi-Fi service and an excellent phone and all three ring cameras I have purchased will not activate unless I'm home and sometimes that doesn't even work. I wish it did . I hate returning things. There are better products out there just have to look .Never settle for anything, especially if you're protecting something important.
title: Almost impossible to activate to view at any time unless I'm pretty much at my house

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Jocelynn
content: This camera is not it for me. I have a Wansview camera that I bought for a fraction of the cost and am so much more pleased with that camera. Every pro I listed is addressed by the wansview camera. Pros: it picks up motion and alerts you and give you settings in the app to edit the areas where motion will be detected. Cons: motion alerts are given multiple times for one event, it has no ability to be used at night through a window due to the light that was installed on the front that cannot he disabled, it will not let you view recent (even within seconds of being alerted) recorded events unless you have a live subscription that cost $$$.
title: Go for a lower cost option

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Bella
content: Cord that connects to camera keeps falling out no matter how hard I push it in, therefore one of the cameras in the 2 pack I purchased is useless.
title: Defective cord, keeps falling out

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: AR Amazon fan
content: I use these facing out my windows.  I merely disable the microphone.  The motion detection is wonderful.  I love the security it provides. Video capture has been used to assist law enforcement in catching a person who started a fire in the apartment dumpster.
title: Security day and night

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Steve
content: The Ring single camera has a good picture, but the WiFi on it seems weak.  The camera is only 30 feet away from my router and it's own "software" shows that it has a "close to weak signal".  It's not my router.  The audio from it when someone tries to talk to you is crappy.  In terms of recording video, Logicircle has them beat because it will record 24 hours of video WITHOUT a subscription.  This Ring thing, DOES NOT give you any free hours of video recordings.  Plus the Ring plans, if I saw properly, was only two plans. Full plan and ONE device plan.
title: So so camera, short WiFi range.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Ehenn
content: BUYER BEWARE! I unfortunately did not set it up right away as busy with baby and kids. . When I finally had the time to set it up, after the allowed return time I found it had been previously opened. This was clearly evident as the packaging wires were not in their proper slots. I tried to set it up but to no avail. Since then I have asked friends who have similar ring products and still no luck! I had even signed up for the monthly fee to see if that made the difference. I am hearing that is is starting to happen to many Amazon users. You purchase something labeled new but in fact it was previously purchased and returned and apparently not properly inspected. Amazon Prime Customer
title: Product appeared previously Returned! and Does NOT work

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Leslie
content: I use this indoor ring camera to check in on my dogs. The picture quality is good and it covers a lot of area. The night vision is also good. The device is small which I like, the only drawback is that the cord is heavy and can pull on the device and move it. This is easily fixed with a command strip. (I don't want to use the included mounting screws because I want to be able to move it around the house.) I would recommend this to a friend.
title: I like it!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Alicia DeBoe
content: Love this camera works great, wonderful picture even at night, only reason I marked down a star is because it doesn’t alert you if your camera has lost power. I think that’s a pretty important thing to know, if someone breaks in but is out of the motion area and they are able to unplug it without being detected you won’t know until it’s to late
title: Overall love it

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Jim P
content: I have spent hours trying to get this camera to connect to my Ring system. I received a Ring Chime at the same time and it connected just fine. This thing will not connect period!!! I don't know if this is just an issue with this particular camera or whether this is an issue with all their cams. I checked Youtube for installation videos, the reviewers have no problem connecting their cameras so I am completely lost. This camera is going back to Amazon. Hope you all have better luck that me.
title: This thing will not connect to the Ring App.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Gecko T
content: Sometimes it takes a minute to load, or never loads at all. My wifi is very fast, but it does have to go through wifi and then to my phone. Even still, it does record the video that I can check later if needed. The night vision is good, but the real value is how wide if films. It covers my yard and up and down the street in both directions. It was fairly easy to set up. The only thing that took a while was running the cord through the garage and along the ceiling to a plug, but this is still far better than having to have it wired. It's worth the money. I wish I had it sooner.
title: Sometimes Slow, but a Great Tool for Security

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: TuNeS-JR
content: I love them I feel more safe when I’m sleeping and for my family and love being part of the RING family now I have 2 for now have another 1 coming plus a stick up came for outside on my list it makes you ease at mind knowing you have these for protection and for any horrific moment there maybe it’s like having a guardian angel hanging from the sky looking over you the Ring custom care is phenomenal for 3$ a month to have full recorded videos etc take my money know questions asked I’ll be switch to the 10$ a month not bad at all I had the ARLO PRO set up there horrible to these cameras and everything they do they have so much better video quality it’s remarkable the ARLO only did 720p with the cheap cameras that were 200$ and for the HD camera at the time almost 300$ for 1 CAMERA I am a RING CUSTOMER FOR LIFE thank you for all you do and I highly highly recommend this product know questions asked 10/10 all day everyday hands down thanks RING!!!
title: It WORKS PUTS MIND AT EASE FOR YOUR LOD ONES GET THEM!! I PROMISE U WILL AGREE

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: DRAIVA
content: A nice product and well made. The cameras are very clear and can adjust the settings easily in the Ring app. The only issue with this is that the cord is too short which makes it hard for corner wall installations. They should offer it with a longer cord option or change the plug to an adapter making it easier to modify. Please send me a longer cord for both units to make this review the best. Thanks.
title: Quality camera but needs longer cord.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Alve W.
content: I have used the ring security system for several months now and have had great results with it. I have had no problems at all. Have one camera and have thought for a long time that I should have another one. Thought this mini indoor would be perfect. Got it yesterday and tried connecting it today. Spent over an hour trying to connect it to my system using my iPhone. No luck!! Called ring and they tried to help. I had two people work with me for at least half and hour each and they could not get it to connect and turned me over to someone more qualified. Worked with this person for an hour and she finally hung up on me. Didn't say she could not help me. She just hung up and left me sitting there holding the phone. Her thought was that there was something wrong with my router or something at my end. The router is top of the line and almost new and has the new 5g connection. It was showing that the camera was connected. It was a really bad experience. I honestly think the camera was defective in some way. I have already taken it to UPS for return. I will not try to add anything to the ring system ever again. Really bad experience!!
title: will not connect to wify

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Captain R.
content: I have had ring cameras for several years and have basically been satisfied.  My one complaint is that the VOICE is not good.  It is very difficult to talk with anyone on any of the cameras as it is usually with a very broke conversation.  The ring support is excellent and will be there to provide you with any support that you may need
title: Nice camera with good pictures

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Cathy
content: This camera is great!  You can stand it on a shelf or mount it on the wall and the angle is adjustable.  We have ring products so adding this was worth it, and I’d recommend for an indoor camera!
title: A+

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Eli
content: This Cam is practical and functional, however, it should have a different system to connect. To connect it I have to open the app and wait so long sometimes I DO NOT GET SIGNAL , anytime the app has to be reconnected, it is waiting time . For me is not working as I would like . My husband is on hospice I would like to see him and the connection is bad... I got 2 connected only one so far. Any other cámara with better WIfi convection ,  I got 2 of these I need to return one I do not need it anymore because my husband is in bed , he is not walking , so the second one for another room I do not need it anymore. The connection is horrible on my phone, it takes forever to open the app.
title: Not as I was expecting .

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: James O. - Albuquerque
content: Work good, price is right. Sucks that you gotta buy the plan to store literally  any video or look at any past video. If you don’t pay for the plan it’s basically a live view only camera. The plan isn’t that expensive if you have up to two cameras it’s only $30/year. If you have more than that it’s $100/year as of 8/24/2020.
title: Good camera, good price, get the plan

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Lisa Lisa
content: After the Ring 30 day free trial, you cannot return this device. After 30 day FREE TRIAL  the device DID NOT WORK on the same 5G wi-fi channel it had worked on through the trial. It was too late to get a refund for the device on Amazon. This seems like a wicked scam on the part of Ring and Amazon. I spent 4 hours of phone calls with Ring before I was told this detail.  If I upgrade to the $199.00 device I will have a product that SUPPOSEDLY will work on my 5G network.  But I STILL won’t get a refund for the first device.  So if I get the $199 product and I get NO REFUND my investment will be $249.  Ring offered me another 30 free trial for a new device which I could not return after the trial if this product also did not work. So “free” trial cost me $63 with tax. BUYER BEWARE. RING has NO CREDIBILITY with me now.
title: NO REFUND AFTER “FREE” 30 day TRIAL

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
content: I was excited to have a camera in my garage that is integrated with ring camera but it did not last long. Camera started glitching few months after I installed it. Live view is not available anymore and it only captures still images. I called customer support and after restarting every device that has remote relationship to the camera, they just hanged up. I called second time and got "sorry, it's out of warranty". I am loyal amazon customer and have been trying their products for years but the pattern is there, subpar products, short warranties and useless customer service.
title: Poor quality and customer support is useless

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: JCF
content: I like my the basic Ring system so I wasn't worried about buying the Ring cameras.  It takes way too long for my Ring app to connect to the cameras, even when I placed a camera right in my office.  I could look at a live view on my old ADT cameras almost immediately, and the same with my new Arenti indoor cameras. We need a camera in our shop which is about 50 feet from our house. So I placed my Arenti and Ring cameras side by side in the shop. The Arenti still connects nearly immediately, while the Ring takes a while to connect. We tested the Ring motion detector in the shop to see if it would trip the Ring alarm quickly, and that did work well. So I can give a good review to the Ring motion detectors, door sensors, panic button, keypad and base station, but the cameras are a hard no. We'll stick with the Arenti cameras to supplement the Ring basic starter kit.
title: Poor connectivity to wifi

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Variscite
content: It's small and unobtrusive.  I have attached it to the inside of a window right by the curtain so that it's not obvious that it's there and I hide the cord within the curtain.  It's never lost the wifi signal and the night vision if black and white, of course, but the image is clear and sharp.  I'm trying to wait until Prime Day 2020 to buy more.  The videos are only accessible through Ring; you can't save them on your DVR or computer - that's the only downside.  But they make it affordable to save them through Ring.
title: Camera 5 stars.  Not being able to save videos on my computer or DVR - 3 stars.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Alex
content: I will start by saying this, this camera is great, it’s small and picks up a wide range, night vision works great especially in low lighted areas. The motion detection will pick up a bug if sensitivity is set high. No issues with WiFi connectivity other than some issues connecting to Echo Show 8 and 5 then again on iPhone while away, other than that they seem to be working fine now. The ONLY reason this got a ⭐️ ⭐️ ⭐️ overall is because of the limited locations it can be installed. There is a 10’ extended cable that can be added but this is still not long enough for where I wanted to mount the camera. Ring should release a hardwire kit for those that want to use this camera to its fullest. FYI battery is not an option either as I don’t want to get out a ladder every time it goes out.
title: Would have been a 5 ⭐️

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Michele R
content: I was actually surprised by how well this little thing picked up voices. It’s crazy sensitive to motion, as it would alert me to motion everytime the air kicked on and made a tiny flag move a little. I liked that it saved the videos on a timeline so you could scroll back and watch wherever you wanted, but I hate that you have to pay more money to keep that feature. I LOVED that I could keep an eye on my kids even though I was 30 miles away! The price point is too steep in my opinion though. Even if you got to keep the videos, I still felt it was a lot for such a small thing.
title: Not bad

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Ottinger
content: I like the functionality and how this camera integrated into my system. The picture was good quality and the sound wasn't bad.  Unfortunately after 2 months the camera stopped working do to some sort of software issue. I contacted Ring and in about 10 minutes they had diagnosed the problem and determined the camera was bad.  They shipped out a new camera to replace mine the next day.  At 1st I was a little disappointed the camera only last 2 months, but rings outstanding customer service or than made up for it. I would Have no problem ordering additional ring products in the future.
title: Great customer service

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: CobraJ
content: I already had a Ring Doorbell 2, Alarm, and Floodlight Camera. So this was an add on to my system. It was running in less than 5 minutes. The Ring controlling setup can be a little long the first time you set it up. Also adjustment of devices in the app does not always do what you first think they do. Would I buy Ring again ? I just did with this indoor camera and I also bought the new Battery Camera for Outside.
title: I keep adding cameras and lights to my system

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Jake W.
content: Easy to setup - device was pretty much pre-added to my system since I ordered the gateway and the camera through Amazon. The picture quality is pretty great. It adjusts well to varying light levels, and has excellent night vision. The device also works well with Alexa. You can set up routines that trigger based on detection events from the camera. For my setup, it helps to save power by turning off the lights automatically after an hour of not detecting any motion.
title: Easy set up, great video quality

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Patty
content: Bought this for my bedroom to check it out because I’m considering getting them for the whole house. This little thing is amazing it keeps an eye on my pets and you could actually talk back through it which didn’t help because my dog cried when I talk to him. I turned off the sound notification because it will ding every time a pet walk through the room and I have two pets, Osso has a feature where it tells you what’s going on in the neighborhood and I don’t care for that either as I don’t wanna be notified every time somebody’s package to get stolen or something like that.
title: Wonderful product, Works perfectly

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Kenny
content: I bought this device a few days ago and it’s already buggy. The night vision in the kids’ rooms stopped working and had to manually unplug and plug the device again to fix the issue. It was an easy fix but it’s not reliable as a kids monitor.
title: Had to reset to get night vision working again

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Melody Joy
content: I purchased this to use inside my home as an extra security measure.  As a senior citizen living on my own I wanted to see if this could be beneficial down the road as a means for my sons to check on me.  The wide angle view and night vision are beyond my expectations!  If anyone were to come in my house there’s no way to avoid getting caught on video (even crawling!).  I have a smaller home but all outside doors are within view in a central location in my living room.  The motion detector is extremely sensitive so my cat trips it up but having the option to let it ‘snooze’ for a while helps immensely.  Having heard the reports many people are putting them in the rooms of family members in nursing homes to make sure their loved ones are getting the proper care would be a great idea (as long as it’s permitted—but if the nursing home has a problem with this I’d recommend going somewhere else!).  I’m very happy with this product.
title: Extra security at a very reasonable cost

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: JA
content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video. plugged it and set up and worked well. Unplugged it to move it to another spot and it won’t activate. No way to hard reset it. Pressed top button. Pressed and hold. And nothing. Blue light won’t flash. Just idle. No voice announcement either like the first time around saying it was ready to set up. Called amazon for help as it states help is provided. Was on hold for more than 30 min. With no response. If u want Help from ring u have To have a subscription otherwise ur out of luck.  Will be returning. So dissapointed. Update: Amazon replaced product with a new one. Worked for a couple of weeks. Next thing I knew it said it was offline. Followed steps for reconnecting and still no flashing light.  Did everything from moving closer to router, unplugged replugged. WiFi router disconnected reconnected. Toggled WiFi on and off my phone.  No way to hard reset the damn thing so it just sits there idle. Blue light on every 30 seconds as it shows in video.  Need a security cam so I ordered a second replacement by Amazon but no real hope that it will be different. So frustrating.
title: Garbage!!! Been replaced twice by Amazon doesn’t work!!

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: viperamd64
content: Really easy to setup and use.  I mainly use it to check in on my dogs during the day (see what trouble they are into). Funny to watch them respond when I speak over the camera.  Quality camera for great price. highly recommended
title: Simple effective indoor camera

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Terry Best-Rennahan
content: I had purchased other brands of cameras for indoor security and pet watching while out.  I could never get them linked to my internet. I got really frustrated.  I bought the ring doorbell. It was easy to install and I have loved it. SO, I said why not try their other products.  I am so happy I purchased The Ring Indoor Cam.  It was so easy to hook up and link to my current account.  It took me 4 minutes and am very happy to have some ability to monitor my house.
title: Quality Camera

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Kathyjlng
content: This is a JOKE!!!!  SIX FEET OF CABLE IS NOT LONG ENOUGH.  Can't do ANYTHING with it because of the lousy cable.  The only thing they offer is a ten foot and that STILL isn't long enough.  The kicker is that all the longer cords offered ARE NOT COMPATIBLE with the tiny plug on the back of the camera.  Going back.......
title: Don't waste money

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Dan
content: Not sure why, but only after two months of use that both cameras stopped working. won't even power on anymore. I tried to reset, but it's not a software issue. It just won't power on anymore. We didn't even use it much so I'm not sure what the problem is. It's way passed the point of returning it. I'd becareful purchasing this camera. It is already a bit flimsy and low quality build right out of the box. Arlo is a great comparison with more camera functions on it. Arlo is where I would go to if the all my other Ring cameras end up not working out for me.
title: only used for two months and both cameras stopped working. won't even power on anymore.

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: James C
content: I love my outside ring cams so I jumped on the chance to replace my inside cams from other vendors with this new ring cam.  So far so good and it’s nice to have everything in one place.  One major feature missing is recording based on HOME and AWAY e.g. based on iPhone location.  As this is an inside cam that is a critical feature.
title: Good start for inside CAM

product: Ring Indoor Cam, Compact Plug-In HD security camera with two-way talk, Works with Alexa - White
author: Cliff
content: I have this in my living room.  I would like it to automatically turn off when I disarm system and automatically back on when I arm system.  Presently no way to do this.
